Vol. X No.IV

Scottsdale, Saturday, April 25, 2015

Science and Technology | The BASIS Gazette

Science and Technology

  • What's in a Name?
    A rose by any other name would smell as sweet, but an iWatch by any other name would make headlines. Last month marked a departure from the usual naming trends of Apple and Microsoft, tech titans who recently revealed the Apple Watch and Windows 10, respectively.

  • Losing Wallets
    Out flips your handy iPhone and, with just the touch of your thumb, you pay and set off, casually swinging your polythene bag of goodies. Like 3D printing and eye detection technologies, this scenario may have seemed absurd, unfeasible, and impossible several years ago.

  • Scientists Spy on a Cell's Secret Life
    Just as we have memories and experiences that define who we are, each cell in our body has an intriguing past filled with interactions with other cells, molecules, and potential invaders.
